key_points: Alec Baldwin was spotted in a Vermont clothing store, suggesting he is staying in the New England area with his family.
The sighting comes after the tragic shooting death of cinematographer Halyna Hutchins on the set of Baldwin's film 'Rust'.
Baldwin is known for his portrayals on 'SNL' and previous controversies, including his quick temper.
The actor has expressed his devastation over the incident, offering support to Hutchins' family and fully cooperating with police investigations.
Baldwin has shared articles on Twitter indicating that the gun he used on the set of 'Rust' was not checked properly.
The articles suggest that Baldwin was told the gun was safe before it accidentally fired, resulting in Hutchins' death and injuring director Joel Souza.
No charges have been filed against Baldwin as Santa Fe police continue to investigate the incident.
Baldwin's presence in Vermont indicates a desire to be away from the spotlight and potentially avoid harassment.
The paparazzi were able to find and photograph Baldwin despite his low-profile location choice.
The incident has sparked discussions around safety protocols on film sets and Baldwin's involvement.
